meanings.sent1: The dinosaur had a bony tail.
meanings.sent2: The doctor studied the bony structure of the skeleton.
meanings.sent3: The bony fish tried to dance but kept tripping over its own fins.
meanings.sent4: Her bony fingers tapped nervously on the table.
meanings.sent5: The bony cliffs jutted out into the sea, creating a dramatic landscape.

meanings.definition: Having prominent bones or a thin, skeletal appearance.
meanings.sent1: The old man's bony face showed years of hard work.
meanings.sent2: The stray cat had a bony frame from lack of food.
meanings.sent3: The bony tree branches looked like spooky fingers reaching out.
meanings.sent4: Her bony silhouette against the sunset was hauntingly beautiful.
meanings.sent5: The bony horse trotted gracefully across the field, its ribs visible under the skin.
